channel.title: Comments on: PIC16F628 4 RGB LED PWM Controller
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: Evanildo Almeida Costa
item.dc:creator: Evanildo Almeida Costa
item.description: Hello about your work! I found the maximum. I want to do one of these, could you please send me the project? Which compiler did you use? I'm having a hard time compiling your code. I want to learn how to use your example of PWM. Thank you very much.
item.content:encoded:
Hello about your work! I found the maximum.
I want to do one of these, could you please send me the project? Which compiler did you use? I’m having a hard time compiling your code. I want to learn how to use your example of PWM.
Thank you very much.

item.title: By: Phil
item.dc:creator: Phil
item.description: RA5 is not the same as MCLR on those parts. RA5 is a regular I/O pin, except that the output driver is open-drain. I was bitten by the same RA5 problem with the 16F627A a few years back.
item.content:encoded: RA5 is not the same as MCLR on those parts. RA5 is a regular I/O pin, except that the output driver is open-drain. I was bitten by the same RA5 problem with the 16F627A a few years back.

item.title: By: semifluid.com » Blog Archive » 8×8 RGB LED Display
item.dc:creator: semifluid.com » Blog Archive » 8×8 RGB LED Display
item.description: [...] too long until I had the opportunity to work on it again! The current setup is basically 4 of the original 4 RGB LED Controller boards and 12 of the updated DR1r3 boards. All 16 are wired in parallel and being controlled by my desktop [...]
item.content:encoded: […] too long until I had the opportunity to work on it again! The current setup is basically 4 of the original 4 RGB LED Controller boards and 12 of the updated DR1r3 boards. All 16 are wired in parallel and being controlled by my desktop […]

item.title: By: Chris F
item.dc:creator: Chris F
item.description:
I am working with a friend to write a driver interface for our Christmas Lighting program called Vixen to run these. However, I do not see a whole lot on how to set them up. Especially getting the address set and how to send the different commands.
Can I get some more details on that please?
item.content:encoded:
I am working with a friend to write a driver interface for our Christmas Lighting program called Vixen to run these. However, I do not see a whole lot on how to set them up. Especially getting the address set and how to send the different commands.

Can I get some more details on that please?
